question.text: A set of solutions is prepared using <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>180</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of water as a solvent and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>10</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of different non-volatile solutes <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>. The relative lowering of vapour pressure in the presence of these solutes are in the order [Given, molar mass of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo> </mo><mo>;</mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>200</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo> </mo><mo>;</mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>]

solution.text:
Number of moles = wtgmMW=10MW

Relative lowering in vapour pressure depends on no. of mole of solute greater the no. of moleof solute greater in RLVP and smaller will be vapour pressure.

So order of vapour pressure is A>B>C.
